Each player starts with three hearts of different values and patterns. The aim of the game is to be the first to complete a set of hearts with the same pattern.

Attacking

To attack, "Court" by using Court cards of equal or higher value than the heart you're targeting.

Defending

To defend, block Court cards by using other Court cards of higher or equal value to the Court card being blocked.

Win Condition

The first player that acquires three (3) HEART cards of the same pattern wins. If a player loses all his/her HEARTS, the player is out of the game.

212628.name: Mind & Emotions Board Game
212628.description:
The Mind & Emotions game explores our head and heart. In the beautiful box is a playing board, 120 cards, and a single die.

The game is based on the idea that we all have positive and negative states of mind, and positive and negative emotional states. The playing board has 3 columns with mind states on the left, and 3 columns of emotional states on the right. The positive states are on the top, and the negative states are on the bottom.

There are 2 piles of cards - 60 mind cards with blue backs, and 60 emotion cards with maroon backs. On the top of each card is one of the 12 mind & emotion states. In the middle of the card is a word that is an example of that mind or emotion state.

Each player takes a turn picking a card, and uses the word on that card to add to a developing story that’s interesting and fun.

For example, let’s say the first player picks the word SHY and begins the story: "Ever since Barry was a little boy, he was always SHY and had trouble socializing in groups."
The next player picks the word: INVESTIGATE, and continues the story: "One day Barry was reading the newspaper about a neighborhood near where he lived. The article described houses that sounded like an excellent investment, and he decided to INVESTIGATE."
The next player picks the word NEGLECTFUL, and says: "When Barry arrived at the neighborhood, he saw that it was run down, looking as if the owners were NEGLECTFUL of the most basic repairs."
While telling the story, the players move their pieces on the board trying to get each of their pieces into a top or bottom end zone. We’ll now describe the rules of the game.

2 to 6 players can play. Each player gets two pieces that are placed on the start section in the middle of the board, one on the left mind side, and the other on the right emotion side of the board. Each player moves one piece up and down the mind side, and the other piece up and down the emotion side. The goal is to get each piece in either the top or bottom end zones.

On your turn:

Roll the die to see how many spaces to move either piece.
Then pick a card from either the mind or emotion pile, and say out loud the category and word you picked.
If you picked a mind card, move your mind piece. If you picked an emotion card, move your emotion piece. If the word you picked is positive, move your piece up. If the word you picked is negative, move your piece down.
If the die is 2, 4, or 5, move your piece that many spaces. If the die is 3 or 6, move your piece 3 spaces up OR down. If the die is 1, roll again right away, and on this move you can move up OR down.
So there are two goals of the game. The first goal is to tell an interesting and fun story together. The second goal is to be the first to get both of your pieces to an end zone. The end zones do not have to be reached by an exact number of moves.

Positive-mind cards:
Analyzing, Interested, Aware
Negative-mind cards:
Oblivious, Uninterested, Unaware
Positive-emotion cards:
Up, Outward, Warm
Negative-emotion cards:
Down, Inward, Cold

You and your friends will enjoy many hours together playing the game of Mind and Emotions!!

212629.description:
"The stolen items will be taken by me... no, us!"
The knights would like to take the honor, ... no, they want just a public interesting. Additionally, they are very sly for all. They can take the credit from other knights for the own.

This game is a collecting card game.
Each player has a card pile with a same card set. Each player draws 5 cards, and places 2 cards on the front from them as scoring cards for all.

Then, each player places one card to the stolen item from a hand clockwise, and the knights pick up them. But please take care of, only the LAST PLAYED PLAYER to the stolen item can take it and get the points.
The winner is the player with most points.
212629.name: Sly Knight Robbery

212630.description:
This expension includes This pack contains 2 models, 2 character sheets (English on one side, French on the other), two Overlord tiles (non-lingual).


Valeria


This version of Valeria will still be adept at close quarter combat, however, she will be a more lightly equipped incarnation, faster and more dexterous, with other uses than just combat.


Taramis/Salome


Then, we have Taramis, the queen of Khauran. She eschews personal combat almost entirely but she brings her personal bodyguards to the table as well as being a great boon to her allies."
But that's not all! Taramis's evil sister, Salome is also playable with this pack as an Overlord minion. They are in fact twins and it is almost impossible to tell one from another, something that Conan discovers to his peril in the tale A Witch Shall Be Born.
Salome is a sorceress of great power and she is able to draw upon the being known as Thaug (a HUUGE creature) to crush her enemies!
212630.name: Conan: Paolo Parente Guest box

212631.name: Goal! (1993)
212631.description:
Box back
When it comes to reating action-packed, super playable football games, no one can bear Dino Dini, the mastermind behind Kick Off and Kick Off 2, except Dino Dini himself, that is ... Now Dino has surpassed all his previous effords, Goal! his latest excursion onto the pitch, offers greater depth than any other footie game you've seen, what's more, it's got a host of features that make getting to grops with the gameplay a delight and mastering it the ultimate challenge, Goal! has all you'll ever need - or want - in a footie action game. Just take a lok if the unique features:

Huge selection of fully editable teams, real player names and kits
Editable cup and league systems
Four pitch view - Wembley, Normal Wet and Muddy - all playable in full and half scale, horizontal and vertical
Enhanced grahics with better view of the action
Athmospheric spot sound effects listen to that crowd roar!
Superb refined gameplay and computer controlled players
Every player has 8 carefully selected attributes
Rewind, fast forward, slow-mo saveable action replays
Precise control of corners, throw-ins and free-kicks
Arcade challenge mode

212632.name: Kemonomimi: Moe Races (5E)
212632.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kemonomimi are humanoid characters that were born from the influence of animal yokai spirits mingling with generations of bloodlines of the families they watched over. After a few centuries these families no longer exhibited their original nature, creating new subspecies of humanoids, known as the Kemonomimi.

There are 7 species that are known to exist: red panda, raccoon, dog, cat, fox, hare, and the tanuki.

212633.name: Clerics of Porphyra
212633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Struggling for the Souls of Porphyra- on the Battlefield of Faith!

“For the Twenty and Seven! For the Called Gods of Porphyra!”
“Fawz al-nar, al-ma’an, al-hawa, al-ard! Fawz al-Larba!”
-battle cries during the NewGod Wars

On the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, your choice of faith and patron being is not just a personal preference, but an allegiance to a cause that exists in the Great Beyond! Clerics lead the faithful in their quest for a life worth living on Porphyra, be it for peace… or war! In Clerics of Porphyra, the new exciting release from Purple Duck Games, you can encounter 12 new cleric archetypes like the single-minded Betrothed, the elementalist Cycle Thrall, the suffering Penitent, and the deadly Right Hand. Clerics of Porphyra also contains a new domain specific to the Patchwork Planet, the Porphyrite domain, and the subdomains of Borders and Geranite. And that’s not all! To help your clerics in their holy (or elemental) quests, 16 new feats are included to increase their customizable power, and intriguing new rules such as divine parishes, feat channels and favored musical instruments, for the Gods, Elemental Lords, Slithering Symphony of Chaos, and the enigmatic Ushers of the Psychopomps! Finally, a new hybrid class is included, the Pillar, which combines the martial might of the mounted marvel, the Cavalier, and the pious power of the Cleric; a sample of one of these intriguing warrior-priests is inside as well!

Who shall win in the end, Deist or Elementalist? Get Clerics of Porphyra from the pious parishioners at Purple Duck Games today and find out- Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

212634.name: Evolvo
212634.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Bekunn hails from a planet where the government was greatly alarmed by humanity's ability to mutate into wildly unpredictable and sometimes suprisingly destructive forms. His scientific mission to Earth was to analyze the human genome, isolate the genetics that could cause such transformations, and develop a method to retard or remove it from the humans.

His unique technology, however, drew unwanted attention from the local villains resulting in disaster. Now he was trapped in one possible genetic lineage of humanity, able to metamorphosize into a primitive beast or an advanced psion. Cut off from his people, he seeks to rebuild his machines and re-establish communication with his world. As the criminal EVOLVO, he has the means to do so and complete his mission.

212635.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

You can scale Bobotov Kuk for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
212635.name: Montenegro (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

212636.name: Asylum (1991/Arcade)
212636.description:
User Summary






UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Asylum is an unreleased arcade game developed during and cancelled in 1991. Players take control of one of three characters fighting to escape the eponymous Asylum after being banished there by the mysterious demonic entity and master of the Asylum Mr. G.

212637.name: The Steeps of Ur-Menig
212637.description:
02 of Trilemma Adventures by Michael Prescott, a collection of 1-2 page adventures for fantasy RPG's.

From the intro summary:

"Into the Steeps

It is said that the sorcerer Bethelan drew his
power from the depths of the earth, and that
his chosen place for his meditations is rich
with his treasures."

212638.name: The Watchman
212638.description:
From publisher blurb:

The WATCHMAN! To the world, he's the U.S. Government's premiere agent; a dedicated patriot who has excelled through devotion to the American Way, proper diet, self-awareness & bio-feedback, and the superior training techniques of the U.S. military. He fights the good fight where-ever it is needed making him ever-popular with the people - Even his enemies grudgingly give him great respect.

But behind this facade was an ordinary man. Patriotic, true, but the source of his abilities is one that must be kept from the public.

212639.name: Bile
212639.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mindless juggernaught destroying everything in its path, Bile has no plan to outwit, no agenda to subvert, and no ego to care. It simply exists and it carves a constant path of destruction wherever it goes for no other reason than that. Can you beat raw chaos? Can you stop that which doesn't recognize defeat or even its own destruction? Bile is alien tech gone wild and the world is just in its way.

Bile is a PL 11 character to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

212640.name: The Cage of Serimet
212640.description:
04 of Trilemma Adventures by Michael Scott, a series of 1-2 page fantasy adventures.

From the Situation summary:

"Deep underground, a dying order stands
guard over a restless wizard. But which
is truly the prisoner?"

212641.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Storm King's Thunder
212641.description:
Publisher blurb:

This screen is the perfect companion for those Dungeon Masters running the Storm King’s Thunder adventure, or any journey along the Sword Coast and the North. The front features imposing images of giants, but reminds heroes that they can be defeated, while the back provides the DM with maps and tables to make overland travel as simple as possible.

212646.name: Denizens: Swashbucklers
212646.description:
Slaying in Style!

This is your in-depth guide to giving your GURPS dungeon delver some finesse and flair! With tons of detail on the swashbuckling professions, GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Denizens: Swashbucklers helps your daring, dashing rogue speak with a sharp tongue, nimbly evade enemy blows, and – of course – dress the part. It even provides variety, with suggestions for crafting unusual swashbucklers. Want to play a portly, middle aged aristocrat with a quick wit and a sharp blade? You've got it. As a bonus, there's details for plenty of gear, 20 perks, 20 swashbuckling feats, a smattering of new skill specialties, handy Allies, and a few other surprises.

- Publisher's description

212647.name: Klondike Gold
212647.description: Players start out from Skagway with a “stake” of 1000 ounces of gold. They make their way, with many adventures along the road, to Dawson City and the Klondike Region. Along the road they may be caught in a blizzard, or lose their way along the trail, or they may be attacked by snow blindness, wolves, or chance upon various other adventures and hazards of the trail. At Dawson City players may speculate in various concessions, or they may continue on to the Klondike Region and try to make a gold strike. Once the gold strike is made a player must continue on the trail to the Land Claim Office (with adventures good and bad on this trail, too). Once he has successfully registered his claim and made his way back to his mine he searches for Nuggets of great value. When one of the players has earned his second Nugget the Klondike Adventure is over and players tally their gains from all sources. The prospector who has gained the most gold on his trip is the winner.

212648.name: Continuity
212648.description:
Did Indiana Jones rescue slave children from the Temple of Doom before King Kong terrorized New York city? Did Marty McFly first travel back in time in a DeLorean after Harry Potter's parents were murdered by Voldemort? Did the robots Wall-E and Eve meet before James T Kirk became Captain of the USS Enterprise?

In this game, players take turns trying to play fictitious event cards in a timeline. Featuring 234 cards from over 100 of your favorite fandoms from movies, television, books, and video games, Continuity is a unique and easy to learn card game that anyone can enjoy.

212649.name: Kokurase - Episode 1
212649.description:
User Summary

The Kokurase gang, also known as Cupid’s Helpers, is out to help freshman Sakura woo Yoshimitsu, a popular senior with every other girl in school vying for his heart.

212650.name: GOUGGY
212650.description:
Baby GOUGGY is unhappy for different reasons. He may want; a dressing, a toy, pacifier, milk, his ball or take a bath. Determine why his sad and give to him what he desires. Take care to your babies GOUGGY not happy! Opponents can put down different disadvantage cards on them; booger, dirty bib, pee and even ... a big poop!

GAME PLAY
Each player performs this steps in order :

1. Draw from the draw pile and/or the discard pile for a total of 6 cards in your hand.
2. Place a Gouggy not happy face up in front of you to start a baby pile. Each player may have no more than 3 baby piles underway at a time.
3. Use a subject (dressing, toy, pacifier, milk, ball or bath) to continue your baby pile.
4. Once you have placed the appropriate subject card on your baby pile, you can place a Gouggy happy on that pile.
5. Place that baby pile face down in your points pile to make room for a new baby pile.


Slow down an opponent by placing a disadvantage (booger, dirty bib, pee or poop) over a Gouggy not happy. If another player places one of this card on one of your baby piles, you must first remove the card before you can continue building that baby pile. On your next turn, place the appropriate subject (handkerchief bib clean, powder, nose clip) to remove disadvantage. Once you have done this, place the disadvantage and the subject in your points pile.



The game ends once the player who draws the last card from the draw pile has taken his/her turn. When the game is over, count your Gouggy happy you have in your point pile. The winner is the player with the most Gouggy happy.

212652.name: The Doom Sphere
212652.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In the depths of the Zone, an enormous and strange ruin rises through the zone smog…”

Welcome to the Doom Sphere, a dark and grim mysterious place of utter decay, where once the Ancients gathered in number to witness spectacles and feat. Now a gargantuan desolate place, haunted by spectres of the past… A place that other stalkers take every effort to avoid…

This exciting new supplement takes players into a far and grisly part of the Zone, where more horror awaits and more mysteries unravel…

212653.name: Denizens of the Sinkhole
212653.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In the depths of a dead ruined city, a enormous and strange indentation appears amidst the wreaths of smog”

Welcome to the sink hole, a mysterious labyrinth, where strange dwellers hold their own dark secrets and surprises. Whole new underground societies have evolved in this huge crater, which hosts bizarre new mutations and hidden enigmas, where players may encounter airborne spores and even a brand new form of life, as they explore its many secrets.

This exciting new adventure takes players into an undiscovered part of the Zone, where more horror awaits and more mysteries unravel…

212654.name: Blood Vaults of Sister Alkava
212654.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nightmare of Blood!

The village of Karvolia has paid its annual tribute of blood to the Red Goddess—but this year, none of the donors returned. Now the priestess commands the village elders to send another dozen young men and women to the edifice of stone that looms on the cliffs overlooking the village: the dreaded Blood Vaults.

The terrified elders are willing to pay adventurers handsomely to find a way to make this second tribute pass them by. Unfortunately, the latest set of donors has already entered the Blood Vaults, and are being prepared for the donation process…

The Blood Vaults of Sister Alkava is a 5e compatible adventure for four to six player characters of 5th to 6th level! It includes:

A macabre adventure set in the vampire-ruled Principality of Morgau and Doresh
Deadly new foes, including the blood pudding, blood zombie, and Sister Alkava herself
Gorgeous full-color art by Bruno Balixa, Micah Epstein, Marcel Mercado, Florian Stitz, and a map of the Blood Vaults by Michael Tumey
Written for the Midgard Campaign Setting, this adventure can be dropped into any 5th Edition campaign, and uses monsters from both the Monster Manual and the Tome of Beasts. Both volumes are required for maximum playability.




Can you infiltrate the Blood Vaults, rescue the victims, and stop Sister Alkava before her power grows too great to contain?

212656.name: Greenwich Village, 1913: Instructor's Guide
rpg: Greenwich Village, 1913: Suffrage, Labor, and the New Woman
212656.description:
(from "Brief Introduction to the Game," pages 5-6)

Greenwich Village, 1913: Suffrage, Labor, and the New Woman takes students into the bohemian enclave in lower Manhattan where men and women from all parts of the United States have gathered to experiment with new ways of living and thinking. These rebels from the elites and middle classes not only reject the beliefs and values of their elders, they also hope to use their talents to create a new America for the new century. It is 1913 and everything seems possible: men and women free themselves from family responsibilities, women become financially independent, the arts and sciences probe the individual’s inner worlds of emotion, vision, identity.

212657.name: Retour à Castel Ashir
rpgseries: EKB - Living Greyhawk Ekbir Regional Adventures
212657.description:
Une aventure régionale Living Greyhawk en un round pour Ekbir

From the introduction:

Dans la vie de tout aventurier, il est un moment où il faut faire des choix en âme et conscience. De tels choix n’auront, peut-être, aucune conséquence, mais qui sait, ils pourront également influencer profondément votre vie toute entière. Saurez-vous faire les bons choix?

Cette aventure en Ekbir pour les [character levels] 2 - 10 se situe dans la trame des Faris Rautha (ou chevaliers métamorphes).

212658.name: Modern Basics: 2016 Annual
212658.description:
From publisher blurb:

2016: The Year Most Of Us Would Like To Forget?

Lots of actors and arists passed away, geeks and gamers were at it each other's throats like never before, terrorists were on the march everywhere around the world, and the United States has been in the grips of the weirdest presidential election ever. It's a certainty that most people will be glad to see 2016 put behind us.

So, naturally, NUELOW Games memorializes the year everyone is sick of with the release our first-ever annual. Because we're all about tapping into what's hot in popular culture!

Modern Basics: 2016 Annual contains two templates, ten talent trees, and eleven feats, most inspired by events in tne news and designed to augment your d20 System characters and bring your games up-to-date with ultra-postmodern age in which we live. Although this OGL material is designed with d20 Modern in mind, it is easily incorporated into your favorite iteration of the d20 System.

212659.name: We're All Going To Die
212659.description:
User Summary:
A diceless game in which all but one character will die.
At the start of the game, the GM determines one character to be the Survivor. As long as that character makes an effort to survive, they will. All other characters will meet their demise at some point.
The only other factor is that each character is good at four things, and bad at two. Everything inbetween is freeform and diceless.

212660.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Pharaoh's Toast

212661.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Gizmo-Grade Oil

boardgameintegration: The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm In!
The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm In!
212662.description:
Description from the publisher:

You and your wicked companions have spent the day pillaging the countryside and "dealing" with meddlesome adventurers. It’s about time you kicked back with a pint at the evil equivalent of The Red Dragon Inn - The Black Dragon Depths, a nefarious tavern hidden deep in the catacombs below Greyport. No more heroes this time. Now you get to play as the bad guys!

The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains is a the next stand-alone expansion to The Red Dragon Inn series of games. In this game you and up to 3 of your friends will be playing as evil villains celebrating the defeat of your archenemies at a wild fantasy party. You will gamble, brawl and drink the night away as you compete to be the last villain standing at the end of the night.
212662.name: The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains

212663.name: Biberbande Schnupperspiel
212663.description: Free cutout edition of Biberbande with only 32 (not 66) cards. The original goes up to 6 players, this version only supports up to 4.

212664.description:
A promo card for Snowdonia, given out for free at the Surprised Stare Games booth at Spiel 2016.

Only 50 copies were printed, so this card is very rare.
212664.name: Snowdonia: Mrs Larkin's Washing Machine

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212665.name: Holy Word
212665.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure for the Theocracy of the Pale

From the introduction:

Could it be that someone has found the long lost treasure of Talavir Markum? The Church would like to find out, and you are the people for the job.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212666.name: The Absence of Law
212666.description:
A Two-Round Continuous Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The death of a mighty green dragon meant one less foe for the Theocracy of the Pale. It also meant there was an opportunity for some other creature or tyrant to fill the void left by the dead dragon. Who knows what power or peril could have replaced the dragon? A long trek through the treacherous Rakers at first thaw is the only way to find out.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212667.name: (P)al(e)ientoloy
212667.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Theocracy of the Pale has always had a reputation for being inhospitable to travelers and strangers, but this is getting out of hand. Now the Prelates and the Merchant Council need your help in solving the mystery of the disappearing merchants before the supplemental food trade is disrupted beyond hope.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

212668.description:
Description from the publisher:

Drawing Dead is a card game where you assume the role of a saloon patron from the Wild West in order to lie, cheat, and steal your way through a game of stud for the highest stakes imaginable: your soul. The characters in this world are doomed to walk the land of both the living and the dead, hoping to win this game in order to buy themselves a restful sleep - six feet under.

In order to win the hand, you will have to draft one of the many roles available to the players and use the character's special powers to improve your own hand and stop your opponents'. The game is familiar enough for those who know only the basics of poker, but robust enough to keep even the most avid gamer invested from start to finish.
212668.name: Drawing Dead

212669.name: 5e x 5 Characters
212669.description:
User summary:

This document presents methods and examples for adapting 5th Edition games to a percentile (d100) system.

The topical focus is on character conversion, giving general rules as well as numerous examples.

212670.name: 5e x 5 Monsters
212670.description:
User summary:

This document presents methods and examples for adapting 5th Edition games to a percentile (d100) system.

The topical focus is on monster conversion, giving general rules as well as examples of nearly every monster in the base system.

212671.name: 5e x 5 Equipment & Treasures
212671.description:
User summary:

This document presents methods and examples for adapting 5th Edition games to a percentile (d100) system.

The topical focus is on equipment and treasure (including magical items) conversion, giving general rules as well as examples of numerous magical items from the base system.

212672.name: 5e x 5 Spells
212672.description:
User summary:

This document presents methods and examples for adapting 5th Edition games to a percentile (d100) system.

The topical focus is on magical spell conversion, giving general rules as well as examples nearly every spell in the base system.

212673.name: 5e x 5 Combat & Conditions
212673.description:
User summary:

This document presents methods and examples for adapting 5th Edition games to a percentile (d100) system.

The topical focus is on combat, giving general rules as well as specific examples, including a consideration of status conditions.

212674.name: Rainbow World
212674.description:
A Short Game of Collaborative World Building and Candy

From the introduction:

Rainbow World is a colorful and varied place with an exciting and complex history. Beyond that any details are up to you and your friends. This is a game that helps you rapidly go through the process of creating a fictional world, brimming with as much interesting detail as you want. Rainbow World is an imaginary sandbox that you can build up, knock over, and rebuild as many times and in as many different ways as you want. Players don’t really win or lose Rainbow World; it’s a cooperative game about creativity.

User summary:

This is an expanded version of the game originally submitted to the 2016 200 World RPG Challenge.

212675.name: Tanks: Caen Game Mat
212675.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 36" by 36" high quality printed vinyl mat, perfect for your tanks to engage in combat in Tanks!

This mat has the French town of Caen. Fight it out with tanks among narrow streets of the town. Additional terrain elements and rules for playing with these features can be found on the GF9 website.

212676.name: Gameshop Collector
212676.description:
This is the 6th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012), Gameshop Gladiators (2013), Gameshop Adventurers (2014), and Gameshop Expansions (2015)

To Win: Have the best gameboard collection by scoring the most
Victory Points (VP) based on your owned games and add-ons.

Setup: Each player receives 1 Collection Tracks card,
1 $/Shelves/Add-ons card, and 10 markers. Place 1 marker on the
1 Shelving Unit Track space and 1 marker on the $3 space on the
$ Track. 4 of the remaining markers will be used to mark Add-ons purchased. The other 4 markers will be used to mark a player’s owned games on the Collections Tracks. The 2 dice are given to the player who was chosen to go first. The first player will be the one who has most recently been to their favorite local gameshop.

Play: Each player’s turn consists of three phases:

Phase 1 Upkeep: Pay the listed upkeep fee on each of your Shelving Units. For each Shelving Unit a player cannot pay the fee for they must move a marker back 2 spaces on a Collection Track of their choice. Players do not pay the Upkeep fee on their first turn.

Phase 2 Dice: The player rolls the 2 dice and they may then reroll any die or dice an additional two times.

Dice are then used as follows:
(Note: dice faces 1 (red) and 2 (yellow) do not count as Collection Track colors)

A. Move a marker, adding games to a colored Collection Track matching one die color rolled (3 (orange) 4 (green) 5 (blue) 6 (purple)). The amount moved will be equal to 1/2 the value of the other die, rounded up.

B. Move a marker one space on a Collection Track matching one die color (3 4 5 6), and add the other die’s value to your $ Track.

C. Add both die values to your $ Track. Your opponent then moves a marker on any one of your Collection Tracks back 1 space.

For each Shelving Unit a player owns, they may move past the space (this space shows the first VP scoring amount on each track) on one Collection Track. They may not move past this space on an additional Collection Track until they own an additional Shelving Unit.

Phase 3 Expand: The current player may now purchase 1 Add-on and/or 1 Shelving Unit if they have the money to do so. Pay the listed cost and move the marker down that amount on the $ Track. Place a marker in the space next to the purchased Add-on. The first player to purchase a listed Add-on receives a $1 discount off the purchase price. The dice are then passed to the other player.

Add-ons: 1 Add-on may be purchased by a player each turn.
The first player to purchase a listed add-on receives a $1 discount off the purchase price. Score VP at game end.

Game End: The game ends when 1 player purchases all 4 Add-ons or
when a player reaches the maximum VP space on one Collection Track. The player’s opponent may then take 1 final turn.

Score each Collection Track you own a Shelving Unit for. Each track shows a VP number in a circle next to certain spaces on that track. Score the highest VP value reached or passed on a Collection Track.

Score additional VP for any purchased Add-ons the player has.

Highest VP score wins!

212677.name: Maze Rats
212677.description:
From the introduction:

Maze Rats is an RPG and sandbox toolkit for old-school-style adventuring. It contains a single, compact page of rules, a one-page character creation guide, a hand-drawn character sheet, and eight pages of random tables'
...
Maze Rats offers everything you need in a compact, easily-referenced format. Also included is two pages of advice for preparing and running open-world games in the OSR style.

User summary:

The game uses a simple 2d6 system for action resolution.

212678.name: Dungeon Reave
212678.description:
From the introduction:

Dungeon Reave is a game of skill, strategy, imagination and roleplaying. The game is simple to learn, easy to play and moves along as fast as you want it to. With quick character creation, only two pages of actual rules and simple monster stat blocks it won’t be long before you are exploring dark dungeons and ancient ruins in search of gold, glory and adventure. So strap on your armor, ready your spells, unleash your imagination and enter the fantastic realms of Dungeon Reave.

212679.name: Xtraor
212679.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Enter the fantastic world of Xtraor, where super-powered characters battle monsters, mutants, minions and villains in a post-apocalyptic world. Character creation is quick, the rules simple and brief and game play is as fast as you want it to be. Xtraor includes rules for character creation and actions, Power Cards, and more! Gather your heroes and enter the Xtraordinary world of Xtraor!

212680.name: Fin de Siècle (2nd Edition)
212680.description:
From the introduction:

Fin de Siècle is a rules-light game about fictitious scientific breakthroughs at the end of the 19th century: this is the world as seen by H.G. Wells and Jules Verne, with eccentric lone inventors making discoveries with the potential to change the future. The protagonists portrayed by the players of this game are those charged with controlling and policing these breakthroughs: basically, this is Victorian Fringe.

212681.name: Wondrous
212681.description:
From the introduction:

Wondrous is a collaborative storytelling game with simple mechanics designed to give minimal resistance to the narrative. For each gaming group, one of the people playing this game will be the gamemaster (GM) who will facilitate the game play by telling the other players about what is happening in the world, controlling the non-player characters (NPC’s), and determining the difficulty and nature of the challenges that the other players characters will face. The other players will be controlling their own player character (PC). While everyone involved is crafting the story together, the GM has the most responsibility because they are in charge of many more aspects of the game, including having the final say in disputes.

User summary:

Note the copyright on the game document states 2017, though the game was published in 2016.

212682.name: Pröletarii
212682.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You hear the distant rhythm of hammers repeatedly hitting steel, and the crackle of sparks from welding. The smell of burning kerosene fills your nose, and your eyes water from drops of sweat and soot that insist on getting through your mask. You wear dirty, greasy gloves; worn boots; and an apron that is dirtier than the soul of a murderer. One of your hands is missing two fingers and your pockets hold only a voucher for just one meal... and it's still the first day of the week...

Welcome to the factory.

Pröletarii is set in a pseudo-Soviet dieselpunk milieu.

User summary:

Pröletarii uses the Five by Five mechanical system but forms a standalone game.

212683.name: Saturday Morning Tabletop: The Beginner Game
212683.description:
User summary:

The game provides series of systems to enable tabletop play in any cartoon style, from fantasy magical combats to slapstick anthropomorphic animal battles. A variety of play levels are presented, and scenarios may be implemented with one of three "ratings" (essentially, levels of complexity).

212684.name: Saturday Morning Tabletop Character Sheet
212684.description:
User summary:

This two-page, color PDF provides a standardized character sheet for the game. The PDF is provided as a form with fields for data input. The blank or completed form can be saved and printed.

boardgameintegration: EverZone: Strategic Battles in the Universe
EverZone: Strategic Battles in the Universe
212685.description:
Description from the publisher:

Plan your battle. Marshal your armies. Eliminate the opponent.

EverZone is a strategic card game set in a distant future. Each player is in command of forces in order to defend his race and expand the control in the universe. Three races (Numan, Slurr and Uthron, most commonly distinguished between humans, aliens and robots) fight for the galaxy on different battlefields: uncharted lands, seas of planets and in the cold space.
The game's goal is destroying the opponent's "headquarters" by reducing to zero his command points (same as life points). To achieve this, players have 330 cards between units, supports and locations in order to build their own forces deck to use in battle against opponents, in the locations determined by each player. EverZone introduces a revolutionary game mechanism to minimize random elements, creating extremely tactical challenges.

EverZone: Colony Assault is not a mere expansion of a game already published some time ago, but it's a sort of EverZone 2.0.
In this new game you will have:

A new and more complete rulebook,
330 brand new cards with balanced and refined powers to give you a more exciting gaming experience.
A stand alone box, so that you won't necessarily need the basic game to play EverZone, but you can combine both of them to have wider strategies.




Besides, a third kind of card will be introduced: the structures.

Structures are paid by your own command points (or life points) and remain in the battlefield with permanent powers for your army until they are destroyed by opposing attacks.
212685.name: EverZone: Colony Assault

212686.name: Iqbal Farooq's Kebab-matador
212686.description:
Kebab-matador is base on Nørrebro, Copenhagen, Denmark. Here you have to buy all the stores and shops before the other players, so you can become the biggest gangster boss in town.

Unlike regular Matador (Monopoly) this game contains two alleyways where you can win big or almost lose it all!

The game is made from the idea of Manus Sareen who also wrote the Danish children book series "Iqbaal Farooq", and illustrated by Lars-Ole Nejstgaard.

The game is in Danish, and the first edition contains a free e-book on "Iqbal Farooq - og den sorte pjerrot"

212687.description:
Description from the publisher:

Play as a coven of witches conniving to concoct potions to entrance the local population! Each turn players choose from one of their 5 witches in a blind reveal mechanism. Each witch allows the collection of ingredient cards (to collect as sets) and condiment cards (to increase the value of specific sets). However, each witch picks specific types of cards and incorrectly deduce who earlier players pick and you may be left with nothing to pick up! The "recipe" cards included also give secret bonuses for concocting specific ingredient/condiment (potion) combinations which allow for great replayability and strategic depth.
212687.name: Cauldron Master
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 040 – Airecon 4

212688.description:
Description from the publisher:

Cthulhu Crusades is a fast paced card game, as much about chance as strategy, set in the dark Middle Ages under the sway of the Necronomicon.

Storm the castle walls, make sacrificial offerings, invoke and call up creatures in this highly snappy card game.

*How to play

Your objective is to storm the enemy castle and take possession of their copy of the Necronomicon.

The shields represent the defence value of the castle.

To storm a castle you have to carry out an attack (swords) superior to its defences (shields).

To launch an attack you should gather army formations, represented by soldiers, bowmen and / or siege weapons cards (you can attack with one or several cards at once).

An attack is successful if the total number of swords (attack) is greater than the shields (defense) of the attacked card.

The Village deck provides the basic resources of your village: soldiers, archers, gold, cultists, sacrifices, builders, thieves, etc.

You start out with five cards and at each turn you will steal a card from this deck and carry out one single action (attack, defend, build, call up, sacrifice, etc.).

A castle cannot be attacked while its walls protect it.

You can place army units in defensive positions to enhance your defence.

The Siege deck contains siege weapons to carry out more powerful attacks.

Use builders and gold to construct your siege weapons.
Get special cards to scale the walls with greater speed and trick your enemies with the Cthulhu offering.

The sea hides the terrible Deep Ones. If you manage to keep them happy by offering sacrifices, they will reward you with additional resources but… you never know how many Deep Ones might come!

Lay ambushes for your enemies, steal their gold and surprise them with a night-time attack so they can’t tell what you’re attacking them with.

Use the arcane knowledge of your cultists to call up the powerful creatures of the Cthulhu deck and scare the wits out of your rival while in combat.
212688.name: Cthulhu Crusades

212689.name: Bridge Constructor Stunts
212689.description:
Stuntman and engineer in one? No problem with Bridge Constructor Stunts!

Build imposing ramps and loops to reach your goal in the diverse stages. But building structures alone isn't enough this time: you sit behind the wheel of the vehicles yourself and have to maneuver them skillfully to the goal. Collect stars, complete daredevil jumps, flips and spectacular stunts, leaving behind a trail of destruction across the entire level to beat the high score. But you can only do all that with perfectly constructed bridges and ramps.

Source: The Developer Website.

212690.name: Epic Fights: Kung Fu Masters
212690.description:
A two-player microgame with 18 cards.

Winner of the 2015 18 cards game contest.

Epic Fights: Kung Fu Masters is a confrontational two-player game, with a quick, very light, tactical gameplay. Two kung fu masters battle each other in 9 rounds, using various techniques and building up combos.

212692.name: The Dragon & Flagon: Secret Room!
212692.description:
Promo coaster released at Gencon 2016

Spilled Ale:

Place the Spilled Ale side of the coaster on the board. It covers a 3×3 square area. These are called ‘Ale’ squares.

Any character that moves into an Ale square (and is on the floor) slides until they move off of the coaster, or hit a table, wall, or another character. This only counts as one square of movement. They may continue moving once they exit the coaster or are stopped.

If they hit a table, they stop sliding. If they slide into a square with another character, both characters start sliding until they are both no longer on the coaster, or hit a table or wall.

If player is Knocked Back onto an Ale square, they slide as above.

Rules for POKER TABLE:

The Poker Table side of the coaster can be used one of two ways:

As a Poker Table: Use two Large tables to support the Poker Table on the board. It is a 3×3 table, and is subject to all Table rules. It may be pushed, flipped, etc. The two tables that are supporting it are considered part of the Poker Table.

For Ilicit Gambling: The coaster is placed off of the board. Any time a character has to give reputation to another character, and the Coaster has three or fewer reputation on it, place one Reputation from the bank on to the coaster, in addition to the normal effects of the Action.

If the coaster has four or more reputation on it, the next time a character gains reputation they also take all the reputation from the coaster.

If an action causes multiple characters to give reputation, one reputation per character goes on the coaster. A character may only take the Reputation when it has at least four at the start of the Action.

212693.name: Tome of Secrets (V20 Dark Ages)
212693.description:
From the back of the book:

"Every occult order worth its weight has a library of mystic truths. But the truly wondrous, truly frightening truths require you look deeper. That you delve in long, lost places. These, my friend, are those long, lost places."
— Creidne

The Tome of Secrets is a treatment of numerous topics about Cainites and stranger things in the Dark Medieval World. It’s about peeling back the curtain, and digging a little deeper. Inside, you’ll find:

Expanded treatment of Assamite Sorcery, Koldunic Sorcery, Necromancy, and Setite Sorcery
A look at Cainite knightly orders, faith move- ments, and even human witchcraft
Letters and diaries from all over the Dark Medieval World

212694.description: The COOKS of the CULT OF CTHULHU meet for the annual cooking ceremony of the tentacle stew. Whoever manages to chop the best pieces off the RITUAL TENTACLE will be appointed CULT CHEF for the next year.
212694.name: Cooks of Cthulhu

212695.name: Invasion: Free State
212695.description:
They might look alien to us, but they bleed. Believe me — I've seen it. I was sent here to tell you that all over the world people are arming themselves against the alien threat. You must do your part here in Maryland. We're few, but we can win this war — as long as we're united.

Keep your head down… caught in the open, you will be dead.

Inspired by such classic computer games as X-COM: UFO Defense and Laser Squad, Invasion: Free State is a competitive urban tactical combat board game for 2 to 4 players. In each mission, Alien and Resistance factions conduct combat against each other in a desolate district of Annapolis suburbs.

To win, you need to predict and avoid the enemy maneuvers with simultaneous initiative and action selection system. Use cover to your advantage and don't let them outflank you.

Endless variability is provided thanks to a modular board and the unique character selection system.

212696.name: Murder Bunnies
212696.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Murder Bunnies...

We introduce trius vrai, a race of hostile humanoid rabbits known for their violent dealings with the other races!

Included are 4 racial archetypes for trius vrai: Burrowing Bandit (Kineticist), Primal Vessel (Spiritualist), Ruthless Abductor (Brawler), and Warren Guardian (Druid)!

Also featured are trius vrai equipment: abduction rope, ambush screen, and ruhkstior!

Two trius vrai weapons: ambush rope and rope harpoon!

Six trius vrai feats: Blood-Crazed, Fast Digger, Fur Pile, Quick Hop, Vicious Bite, and Vicious Hop!

Three trius vrai magic items: lucky halfling's foot, quarry pole of manageable portage, and stumbling stones!

And three trius vrai spells: stunning strike, phantom drummer, and sticky double!

212697.name: New Havenwater
212697.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the centuries-old town of Havenwater was burnt to ashes by a dragon, the survivors of the lake town didn't give up, or despair. They defeated the dragon and then began to rebuild their home. The result was the fishing village of New Havenwater. And so it will stand..for generations. Or at least until the next dragon comes along...
A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A wooden town or village on a lake, or the sea. Wooden houses, surrounded by jetties, quays, harbours and docks. This laketown settlement features dozens of buildings, with numerous houses, and useful locations such as a temple, town hall, taverns, grocers, armourers, adventurer shop, warehouses, fish market, and much more.

Download includes:
250dpi A4 pdf map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing

212698.name: Dinosaur Companions
212698.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Dinosaur Companions...

We introduce 25 new dinosaurs (and pterosaurs and a crocodilian) to choose from to be your new best friend! Every dinosaur can be an animal companion/mount or familiar!

15 of these prehistoric pals are animal companions/mounts: Argentinosaurus, Baryonyx, Concavenator, Corythosaurus, Deinocherius, Dilophosaurus, Dracorex, Excaliborsaurus, Maiasaura, Neptunidraco, Scipionyx, Stygimoloch, Tethyshadros, Tupandactylus, and Utahraptor!

10 of them are familiars: Coelophysis, Jinfengopteryx, Leaellynasaura, Mei, Micropachycephalosaurus, Microraptor, Nyctosaurus, Parvicursor, Scansoriopteryx, and Sordes!

Also featured are 6 mini prehistoric encounters to spice up a campaign!

212699.name: Tower of Hidden Doors
212699.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party must track down the killer of a prominent town noble. Their search leads them to the time-forgotten Tower of Many Doors. This ancient stone structure has long been cursed by its last inhabitant, who's restless spirit has never left. The heroes must traverse this terrible place to find the murderer, but will its curse trap them inside the tower forever?

Contained herein:

The tower of Hidden Doors, an adventure for 2nd level characters, by Maria Smolina and Jarrett Sigler.
Gods of Celmae: Amaura, goddess of life and the sea, by James Edar.
Occult Tomes: The Lamentations of the Fungus men, by Robert Gresham

212700.name: Youngblood Keep
212700.description:
From publisher blurb:

FVC8 – Youngblood Keep has a seasoned party meeting with Lady Enorra, a noblewoman at the northern frontier. She has requested the party by name to help her recover a valuable artifact called the Eggstone. After accepting the job you find yourself at a locale known as the Chapel of Ancients and that is when things really get strange! Youngblood Keep used to be a fortress in the area but was ripped from this plane of existence to another. Who’s up for a quick trip to Hell and back?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a group of mid to upper level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

212702.name: Odessa 1941
212702.description:
A small game covering the Rumanian Attack against Odessa in 1941.
Romanian player selects activation chits for his wings and then pull a chit one at a time. He has three wings and two chits for each wing. So, he can have six activations in one turn. But, more activations bring Russian player more command points. With them he can move or attack with one unit.
Victory condition for Romanian is get the control or totally encircle the Odessa until the end of sixth turn.

4 pages rulebook
60 counters
one smaller map (B/W printed)

published on Command magazine #50 in 2003.

republished on #109 in 2013 with full colored map and larger counters.

212704.name: The Night Sparrow
212704.description:
From publisher blurb:

J-pop band, CHI48, are on tour in the US, but rumors swirl around the band that they’ve been cursed. Multiple concert goers have been stricken with blindness shortly after their shows. Unbeknownst to the band, the yokai Yosuzume has become entangled within audio equipment, and the equipment is magnifying the yokai’s ability!

212705.name: Kinfolk: A Breed Apart (W20)
212705.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born to Run

The Garou are born of two kinds: humans and wolves. These are their Kinfolk — those “of the blood.” These special people — whether of two legs or four — carry in them the hope of the Garou: the promise of future generations. Although Garou are born to Kinfolk, nobody knows they’re different until they undergo their First Change. Until such a blessed (or cursed) time, they are just like their more mundane Kin. Most live as humans, suffering the foibles of humanity, all the while hoping they’re secretly special, that they harbor the wolf within. Even though that wolf will never howl for the majority of Kin, they’ve still got a vital role in the war, aiding the effort from behind the lines.

Stuck in Second Gear

This book gives the Kinfolk the spotlight and shows how they live their lives as adjuncts to the Garou — werewolves who could be their sons and daughters, brothers and sisters, even their parents. It explores the society of Kinfolk, both those “kenning” (in the know) and “callow” (ignorant of the Garou). Storytellers will find advice on running Kinfolk-oriented chronicles, while players can discover special Kinfolk Gifts and fetishes, as well as learn the many differences between Garou and Fera Kin.

Kinfolk: A Breed Apart contains:

Overview of the Kinfolk, both kenning and callow, including some of the Fellowships founded by Kinfolk to aid the Garou cause — and to protect themselves from their cousins’ Rage.
Character creation for playing Kinfolk, including new Skills, Backgrounds, Merits and Flaws, as well as special Kin rites, Gifts, and fetishes.
Guidelines for running Kinfolk chronicles, as well as in-depth information on the Kin-Fetches, the unique spirits used by Garou to watch over their distant cousins and warn the tribes if one of them should undergo the First Change.

212706.name: Across
212706.description:
ACROSS is a roomscale VR game, where you are tasked with a simple objective : cross the room.

Source: The Game Website.

212707.name: ROCKOMAN
212707.description:
ROCKOMAN is a bigger and better version of the famous game ROCK–PAPER–SCISSORS. Fight with ROCKOMAN's superheroes to get the most points.

GAME PLAY
The players take turns going clockwise. On your turn, draw one card from the draw pile and place it, face up, next to the draw pile, in the discard pile. If your card beats the one of top of the discard pile, place all the cards in the discard pile in your point pile (rock beats scissors, scissors beat paper and paper beats rock).

When you draw a super card, place it face up next to your point pile. The super card beat card on the top of the discard pile at any time (rock suoer card beat scissors, paper super card beat rock and scissors super card beat paper).

When you place gun card, good card, sick card, rock-paper-scissors card, ring card in the discard pile, does the specified action to the opponent (take or give 3 cards, take his super card, play the standard game and the winner takes 5 cards from the loser’s point pile).

The game ends when the draw pile runs out. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game. Each card in your point pile is worth 1 point.

212708.description:
Expansion for Kodama.

(translated from the title card)
Contains 28 cards:
- 12 Season cards
- 7 Kodama cards
- 9 mini-Kodama cards

The mini-Kodama's enable you to play the game with kids from 6 years old and up instead of the normal 8 years and up.
212708.name: Kodama: Les Esprits de l'Arbre – l'Extension Florissante

212709.name: Zodiac Empires: A Fantasy Campaign Setting
212709.description:
From publisher blurb:

The realm of Vathis, having just survived the Darkest War, is a world in an age of early industrialization where the line between magic and technology is obscure at best, and oftentimes indistinguishable. Rich in history and lore, adventurers roam lands dotted with sprawling empires, devious hidden cults, and ruins shrouded in darkness. While revered heroes march headlong into battle, airships have taken flight, transforming both land and sky into battlegrounds. Gritty realism and high fantasy come together in Zodiac Empires, a world built on the memory of great wars, political intrigue, and imperialism.

The Zodiac Empires Campaign Setting contains 300 pages of:

5 Unique Races, each with their own history, culture, and rules.
14 heavily detailed nations, complete with history stretching back centuries.
A highly detailed political landscape (and all the blood that goes along with it).
A pantheon of 17 Deities, as well as 16 detailed Vandiels.
Eldria, the magical resource that fueled our industrial revolution.
10 major Organizations, as well as 30 others.
Rules for playing Starcalled, and all of the background that goes with it.
A fully detailed digital map

212710.name: Zodiac Empires: A Player's Guide
212710.description:
From publisher blurb:

The realm of Vathis, having just survived the Darkest War, is a world in an age of early industrialization where the line between magic and technology is obscure at best, and oftentimes indistinguishable. Rich in history and lore, adventurers roam lands dotted with sprawling empires, devious hidden cults, and ruins shrouded in darkness. While revered heroes march headlong into battle, airships have taken flight, transforming both land and sky into battlegrounds. Gritty realism and high fantasy come together in Zodiac Empires, a world built on the memory of great wars, political intrigue, and imperialism.

The Zodiac Empires Player's Guide contains 150 pages of:

5 Unique Races, each with their own history, culture, and rules.
14 nations to call home for the characters in the world.
A series of 20+ airship classes to assist in overland travel and adventuring.
A pantheon of 17 Deities and assorted other faiths.
150+ items, materials, and services to fulfill the needs of the Vathis adventurer.
Eldria, the magical resource that fueled our industrial revolution.
Over 40 organizations to join, with membership requirements and benefits.
20+ Propaganda and Travel posters that can be found on the walls of the world.
Rules for playing Starcalled, and all of the background that goes with it.
A fully detailed digital map

212711.name: The Eye Of Kings (5E)
212711.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Eye of Kings is an adventure for level one characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure puts your party in a race against a sinister cult of a long forgotten evil to a temple deep within the deserts of Osept. Only cunning resourceful and battle ready characters will be able to survive the temple and reach The Eye of Kings before the Black Scales do.

212712.name: The Eye Of Kings (Pathfinder)
212712.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Eye of Kings is an adventure for level one characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure puts your party in a race against a sinister cult of a long forgotten evil to a temple deep within the deserts of Osept. Only cunning resourceful and battle ready characters will be able to survive the temple and reach The Eye of Kings before the Black Scales do.

212713.name: The Staff Of Life (Pathfinder)
212713.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Staff of Life is an adventure for level two characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure puts the party on a treacherous trek through the snowy wastes north of Tristan in search of a lost relic. The party will need all of their survival skills to navigate the tundra and find the hidden magical oasis where both fortune and danger await them.

212714.name: The Staff Of Life (5E)
212714.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Staff of Life is an adventure for level two characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure puts the party on a treacherous trek through the snowy wastes north of Tristan in search of a lost relic. The party will need all of their survival skills to navigate the tundra and find the hidden magical oasis where both fortune and danger await them.

212715.name: The Wings of the Ancients (5E)
212715.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wings of the Ancients is an adventure for level two characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure finds your party venturing to a broken vault in the middle of the desert near Erygis. The party must use their cunning, stealth, and ability to improvise to make it through the vault and find the treasure they seek within without being apprehended.

212716.name: The Wings of the Ancients (Pathfinder)
212716.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wings of the Ancients is an adventure for level two characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure finds your party venturing to a broken vault in the middle of the desert near Erygis. The party must use their cunning, stealth, and ability to improvise to make it through the vault and find the treasure they seek within without being apprehended.

212717.name: City of Secrets Past (Pathfinder)
212717.description:
From publisher blurb:

City of Secrets Past is an adventure for level three characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure finds your party pursuing the Black Scales to a jungle-covered island south of Washu. Here they must venture through the jungle to find a lost city before the Black Scales can get there and enact their insidious plot.

212718.name: City of Secrets Past (5E)
212718.description:
From publisher blurb:

City of Secrets Past is an adventure for level three characters. Set in the Zodiac Empires Campaign setting, this adventure finds your party pursuing the Black Scales to a jungle-covered island south of Washu. Here they must venture through the jungle to find a lost city before the Black Scales can get there and enact their insidious plot.

212719.name: The Item Hack
212719.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Item Hack is a collection of magical items containing over 80 wondrous treasures designed for use with David Black's fantastic Black Hack RPG. Arm your heroes with magical weapons and armor, prepare your mage with a special ring or tome, riches and glory await!

212720.name: The Talking Board
212720.description:
From publisher blurb:

This talking board was made by Hason Schmidt, a little-known spiritualist from Pittsburgh who got in over his head and succumbed to dark forces in 1891. A dark spirit, Zozo, has trapped Hanson and other users of the board in it, corrupting them to its own terrible purpose. The board always manages to find a new owner through the will of Zozo, and despite Hanson’s desire for the cycle to end.

212721.description:
Description from the designer:

The year is 1921 and the Academy of Magicians has gathered once again to perform their greatest stage tricks. The competition to win the title of World’s Greatest Magician brings out the worst in these rivals who won’t hesitate at a chance to ruin the act. Fortunately, a good magician always has an assistant at their side and a trick up their sleeve…

Magician's Club is a "Trick-Making" game where players are Magicians who play Trick Cards for points. Moving around the table, the other players will try to decrease or modify the Magician's tricks using conjure cards. The Magician can cancel out some cards by using his assistant cards but they are one-time use only cards, so play them wisely. When play returns back to the Magician, they can play one more card and then collect the trick for points (either positive or negative)

After all the players have had a chance to be the on-stage Magician, the points are totaled up. A second chance to score happens at the end of the game by counting up collected cards that have a similar suit. The player with the most points wins!
212721.name: Magician's Club

212722.description:
Description from the designer:

Building the castle is easy! Climbing it is the hard part! Be the first fantasy hero to climb up the castle walls in pursuit of fabulous treasure. But beware of the monsters and misfortunes that can knock you back down!

In Castle Climbers, players lay tiles to build up a fantasy castle that they climb with their character. Players use action points to move their characters and roll dice and play item cards to battle the monsters that bar their way. Win and you keep moving. Lose and you drop back down! The first player to collect 100 gold wins the game!
212722.name: Castle Climbers

212723.name: Bolt Action: M18 Hellcat Platoon
212723.description:
After the experiences of improvised tank destroyer vehicles such as the M3 half-track with 75mm gun, M6 truck with 37mm gun and the M10 tank destroyer (3-inch gun on a modified M4 Sherman hull), the US Army were keen to produce a bespoke tank destroyer to hunt enemy armour. An order was issued in late 1941 to mount a 37mm gun in the requested vehicle. This was to be upgraded several times to 57mm, 75mm and then finally a 76mm.

The result of this development would be the M18 Hellcat - the fastest US armoured fighting vehicle of the Second World War.

M18 Hellcats served in the invasion of the Phillipines and saw action in Europe during the landings at Anzio in Italy and in Northwest Europe.

Hellcats were also exported to China where they served in an infantry support role.

The Hellcat could be found in the service of several nations following World War II with the Yugoslav army still fielding them into the 1990s!

212724.name: Bushido: Prefecture of Ryu Starter Set
212724.description: The Dragon Clan won the rights to colonize the Westward Isles in a series of duels with their rivals, the Shiho Clan. However, when the Emperors vessel expired, and his young heir too young and inexperienced to concern himself with the pretty disputes at the fringes of his lands, the promise of sole settlement rights died with him. The newly formed Prefecture of Ryu found themselves yet again in conflict with their old enemies, the Shiho Clan. Now, the Prefecture’s grasp of power is weakened, due to the recent Tsunami. Their forces are in disarray, they are fighting on all fronts in the aftermath of the disaster. But still the men and women of the Dragon are ready to take their place at Destiny’s table, uniting the human world by defending it against all threats.

212725.name: Bushido: Cult of Yurei Starter Set
212725.description: In the shadows and dark corners of the world, the worshippers of Yurei are gathering force. The many members of this Cult may not even be aware that they are serving the same dark masters, but serve them they do – the Yurei Bargain, which in its various forms allows control over life and death, has proven a temptation to many different people who would otherwise have nothing in common. In the Cult of Yurei, you may think yourself the master of your own Fate but you are always advancing the unfathomable goals of dark unseen masters. Even a puppet master has someone pulling his strings...

212726.name: Bushido: Savage Wave Starter Set
212726.description: They take the form of evil creatures of myth and folklore. From where they come or why, no-one knows, but one thing is for certain, the wave crushes everything in its path. The Oni and Bakemono demon-creatures that make up the bulk of the Savage Wave appear bent on the destruction of humankind and all that is holy, but they are not mindless – as many opponents have found out at great pain, the Savage Wave is cunning and organized, and it operates according to its own weird and unknowable logic. Some mad hermits and outcasts scholars whisper that this is not the first Savage Wave...

212727.name: Bushido: Ito Clan Starter Set
212727.description: The Ito clan have long been the laughing stock of the ruling clans. Never quite able to understand it is their own flaws which hold their greater ambitions back. Being untrustworthy is synonymous with the Ito their support of the Shiho’s rise to power followed by their treacherous role in the Dragon Wars against the very same clan, highlights their fickle nature. Now though the Ito have gone through a transformation, their alliance with an age old and powerful Kami has imbued them with a new found strength. If it was the Kami that caused the snake like changes or whether it has simply exaggerated the Ito’s natural affinity is unknown. What is sure is that the Ito finally have the power to rise against the other clans and avenge the mockery and mistreatment they have suffered.

212728.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 201 - Nov 2016)
rpgissuearticle: The Settlers of the Stone Age
The Village Crone from Fireside Games
Zombiecide: Black Plague from Guillotine Games
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
212728.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 201
November 2016

Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Issues comes polybag bundled with exclusive Burke's Gambit Card and a Walker Mini.

rpg: OS / NR: Old School / New Rules
212729.name: Charaktere Ausrstung
212729.description:
User summary:

This single-page PDF is intended to be printed and cut into four notebook-sized pages. It details the process of generating characters in the game. Attributes are randomly generated with 3d6; other traits are selected by the player.

rpg: OS / NR: Old School / New Rules
212730.name: Regeln
212730.description:
User summary:

This single-page PDF is intended to be printed and cut into four notebook-sized pages (one of which is blank). It details the process of resolving opposed actions, including combat.

212731.name: Charakterbogen
rpg: OS / NR: Old School / New Rules
212731.description:
User summary:

This single-page PDF is intended to be printed and cut into four notebook-sized pages. It provides a character sheet for the game, including a tracking sheet for Attributes.

An alternate format character sheet is provided as a single A4 format.

rpg: OS / NR: Old School / New Rules
212732.name: Magie
212732.description:
User summary:

This single-page PDF is intended to be printed and cut into four notebook-sized pages (one of which is blank). It elaborates on a rules light magic system.

212733.name: 5 tegen 5
212733.description:
Party game for two teams competing against each other.
The game shares its name with the Dutch version of Family Feud, but the game elements have only vague resemblance to that game.
Each game is played in five rounds, varying from a round that plays like Taboo to a round that plays like Time's up.
Points are scored for answering quiz questions (none of them in the style of 5 tegen 5 the tv show). First team to get to 50 points wins the game.

212734.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Essex County Express is the second Mythos Pack in The Dunwich Legacy cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game. Among its sixty new cards, you'll find twenty-eight player cards, including four copies of a new weakness.

You'll also find a thrilling new scenario in which your investigations lead you outside the town of Arkham. While the train you take may offer the fastest transit to your next lead, it may not offer the safest… When the train rumbles, shakes, and lurches to a halt, you and your fellow investigators must race from your car to the engine. If you can't get the train moving in a hurry, you and all the other passengers may fall prey to whatever unnatural things seem to be crawling, shifting, and oozing their way from car to car, growing ever larger as they do so.

Your adventures on the Essex County Express feature a randomized set of locations that greatly enhance the scenario's replayability, meaning this nightmarish ride is one you'll want to take again and again and again!
212734.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Essex County Express
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG

212735.name: 1893: Koln-Bonn
212735.description:
This is the original game that was developed into 1893 Cologne by Marflow games. It is set in the same Cologne region of Germany. There are several differences including a differences in the map, stock chart, minor differences in the major and minor company contents, and a more restrictive tile set.

As with other 18xx games, players start with a set amount of money that they then invest in various companies. As the game progresses, these companies grow and earn income for their owners. Technology increases in the form of better trains with progression through more complicated track tiles. When the game ends, the winner if the player with the greatest net worth.

212736.name: Badgered by Problems
rpgseries: BDK - Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Adventure
212736.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdom Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Boss is livin’ fat and happy on the outskirts of the lands of Iuz. Boss Beare is a man of such stature (or, more appropriately, girth) that not much riles him, but growing troubles have been upsetting his digestion as of late. First is the increasing number of fledgling adventurers in Salfrayfields, piling up like cordwood on the woodpile because they’re not yet strong enough to venture farther into the Bandit Kingdoms. And on top of that, the Boss has lost a number of his men (and some of the villagers he is supposed to be protecting) to a series of animal attacks just north of the village. Boss Beare is looking for a solution that will cover his backside and ease his unsettled stomach, all while maintainin’ his grip on this cushy job. He knows the shadows hold both the eyes of Iuz and the ears of the resistance, so he has to be careful in what he does. Maybe he can play his problems off against each other. It will be up to you to determine if Boss Beare will feast in peace, or remain badgered by problems.

A one-round Bandit Kingdoms Introductory Adventure for 1st level characters only.

212737.name: Two Sides to Every Story
rpgseries: BDK - Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Adventure
212737.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdom Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A lieutenant of the Rookroost guard requests you to hunt down a renegade cult of Iuzian heretics. It seems the perfect task; fight followers of the Lord of Pain while contributing to in-fighting. But is the task really that simple? Your story could be one to tell fellow adventurers around a camp fire, or it may be one only fit to speak of at inns with ones you can trust. Which tale will you be telling?

A Bandit Kingdoms Introductory adventure set in Rookroost for 1st level heroes only.

212738.name: A General Errand
rpgseries: BDK - Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Adventure
212738.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdom Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A chance encounter in the Freehold leads to a job offer. A fellow who claims to be a supporter of freedom and independence has associates curious about the recent happenings in the nearby Barony of Wormhall. Running a general errand is all he asks.

A Bandit Kingdoms Introductory Adventure set in the Barony of Wormhall for 1st level heroes only.

212739.description:
Hushed tales of fantastic beasts under the dark waves have been told throughout the known world for centuries: a giant piranha-turtle with a trident, a sea serpent that swallows ships and crew whole, a bearded dog-lizard with two water spouts on its head... stories so wild as to defy the imagination. While untold sailors have met their grim end by these sea monsters, an intrepid few have welcomed the challenge of discovering them with timeless rumors as their only guide.

In Monstra Maris, 2 to 4 players each control a small fleet of ships, represented by wooden discs, that they sail across the board with the flick of a finger. Their goals are the changing locations on the board where the monsters are rumored to have been sighted. When a player flicks a ship disc onto one of these locations, he or she is awarded points for the discovery and granted an experience token for end-game scoring. Players also hope to avoid the storms and pirates that may come their way, thanks to their opponents. The game ends after one player has discovered twelve monsters, and the player with the most points is declared the winner.
212739.name: Monstra Maris

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212740.name: Prelude to the Past
212740.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A servant of a mysterious wizard wants you to capture a fantastic beast alive. Will you accept the challenge?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

User summary:

In addition to the 30-page PDF scenario document, a separate 11-page PDF of player handouts was provided.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212741.name: Alliance Reborn
212741.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An elven envoy from the Phostwood secures a group of [player characters] to assist the elves in defending against brigand raids.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 6.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212742.name: Festvalle Serendipite
212742.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

For the past twenty years, the Festvalle Serendipite has brought the simple pleasure of the traveling carnival to the humble folk of the Pale. But when a circus comes under new management, the changes aren't always for the better.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212743.name: Northern Brewings
212743.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A blizzard has struck the Province of Rakersvale, but something far more insidious is prepared to strike.

An adventure for character levels 3 - 8.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212744.name: Cold Comfort
212744.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Disaster has struck a small town high in the Raker Mountains. Will your relief reach them in time?

Part One of The Song of Winter.

An adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212745.name: Bewitched
212745.description:
A Two-Round Continuous Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Village of Fensdale appears a model of prosperity and tranquility. But all is not as it seems. Evil is afoot!

An adventure for character levels 3 - 8.

rpgseries: PAL - Living Greyhawk Pale Regional Adventures
212746.name: Siege at Castle Arndulant
212746.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Theocracy of the Pale Regional Adventure

From the introduction:
